intro: Entandrophragma septentrionale, commonly known as the African teak, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its large, elongated leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces hard, heavy wood that is highly valued for its durability and fine grain. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Due to its economic importance, it is often cultivated for timber and local use.
